PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer No. II will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you or those who don't worry about leaving blank spaces.

Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the question.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years although born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

- All questionnaires
- Pioneer diet
- Pioneer schools
- Pioneer recreation and social life
- Pioneer farming experiences
- Pioneers in Saskatchewan
- Pioneer health and housing

Preservation of Questionnaire

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.
A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it is exactly like anyone else. Some of the questions may not apply to your situation or others may prove impossible for you to answer. It does not worry about leaving blank spaces.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years either born in this province or not.

Our family was very poor at first, but we managed to get by. We had to work hard to earn our living.
